homeHeroContent: Hi, I'm Chase and welcome to my website. Here you can find a portfolio of software engineering projects I've built and worked on, a blog covering a mixed bag of interests, hobbies and the occasional luke-warm take, as well as photographs and excerpts from my travels. Enjoy!
aboutContent: As a data scientist and as a self-taught software engineer, I'm fiercely passionate about learning, the pursuit of knowledge, and teaching others. I am also passionate about enabling people and businesses by providing them the tools to live more independently both operationally and financially.

As a developer, I've channeled this passion by creating, building, and working on widely used products such as:
• BitBite, an ordering and rewards platform akin to Grubhub's LevelUp;
• Aravenda, an ecommerce inventory management platform for multiple online storefronts;
• Orchid's Provider Network, a surrogacy journey liason for all requisite parties;
• and more!

All using a variety of stacks, technologies, and api's including React, Ionic, Vue, Flask, and Django for frameworks and Stripe, eBay, Google maps and more to list some api's.

I was lucky enough to attend the University of Florida where I graduated with honors after studying Industrial and Systems Engineering and Economics. Go Gators! I am an avid fan of Florida Gators football, the Miami Dolphins, the Miami Heat, Florida Panthers Hockey, Chelsea FC and Formula 1 (I love the sport as a whole but, I support McLaren).

While at the University of Florida, I fell in love with data science with a focus on financial markets, thus kickstarting a long intended journey into computer science and development. I was fortunate to make lifelong friends, fall in love with a beautiful campus, and work my way through enlightening internships, all to develop and grow into the professional I am today. Namely, interning at a commodities trading house, the Florida Department of Management Services, and an equity trading firm providing the most insight for me personally. The latter offering a return position as an equity trader in New York City after graduation, allowing me to pursue a dream I'd had since high school.

Born and raised in the beautiful beach town of Delray Beach in sunny South Florida, I grew up a waterman, spending extensive amounts of time outside and in the ocean. This lead to my passion for travel, experiencing new and unique cultures, and embarking upon any adventure or new experience I can get my hands on, solo or with friends. To quote the late Anthony Bourdain 'I want to try everything once.' Please see my travel and photography pages for updates on adventures recent and old as well as pictures from the tales. Here you can read and see all about whatever activity I'm currently most interested in.

I also thoroughly enjoy cooking, chess, photography, yoga, and pickleball. Inspired by the likes of James Barkman, Chris Burkard, Allen Stoltzfus, Ansel Adams, Martijn Doolaard, Colin O'Brady and too many more to name, I would one day love to pursue photojournalism, combining other passions of mine: storytelling, photography, and shared experiences. I also love music and have played various instruments throughout my life including the piano, trumpet, guitar, and ukulele. Some of my favorite artists include Led Zeppelin, The Rolling Stones, Orville Peck, Skeggs, Greta Van Fleet, the Grateful Dead, Boston, Ben Howard, MGMT, M83, the Red Hot Chili Peppers, the Foo Fighters, Purity Ring, Reptar, and Hans Zimmer.

projects.title: Chess Engine and AI
projects.summary: A quick passion project of mine, I built this chess engine as a fun project and a quick dive into game development. I wanted to build out a chess engine so I could build bots to play against, train using ML, and study unique chess lines. The entire engine is built using Python and the pygame module. Pygame is very user friendly, and I look forward to building another game using more of its functionality in the future such as its sprite features and potentially joystick as well. Click here to check it out on GitHub!
